chargeHist.descr: Operator Flee/Elude Officer-Bodily Harm or Property Damage

result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy Marill Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer Causing Damage To Property, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Possession With Intent To Deliver Controlled Substance-Cocaine (>40 Grams), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.
  • Possession With Intent To Deliver Controlled Substance-Methamphetamine (>10-50 Grams), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide DNA specimen.  Pay DNA surcharge during extended supervision or civil judgment.
Court waived all nonmandatory and mandatory costs, fees, surcharge, except DNA surcharge, due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at zero.

Complete 8 hours of drivers education.
Complete Cognitive Thinking program.
Mental assessment and comply with any recommended treatment or counseling determined by the agent.
Obtain full time employment or obtain GED/HSED.
No driving without a valid drivers license.

supervisions.notes: On  August 15, 2022:   Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court  advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy Marill Collins

records.addlTxt: Count one.

Defendant Randy Marill Collins in court, in custody.  
Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Randy Marill Collins.  
Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 

COUNT 1:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT 
36 Months, with credit for  228 days time served; 

The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS
MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is   18 MONTHS .

 COUNT 2  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT 
6 YEARS, concurrent to count 1 with credit for 228 days time served; 

The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; 
MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  3 YEARS.

COUNT 3:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT 
36 Months concurrent to Counts 1 and  2 with credit for  228 days time served; 

The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS
MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is   18 MONTHS .

COUNT 4:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT 
36 Months concurrent to Counts 1,  2 and 3 with credit for  228 days time served; 

The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS
MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is   18 MONTHS .

COUNT 5  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT 
2 YEARS, concurrent to COUNTS 1, 2, 3, and 4  with credit for 228 days time served; 

The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; 
MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.

Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for Challenged Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Court waived all non mandatory and mandatory  costs, fees surcharge ( except DNA surcharge) due to inability to pay. 
Provide DNA specimen Pay DNA surcharge during extended supervision or Civil Judgment. t.
Restitution set at Zero. 
Defendant operating privileges revoked for 1 Years as to Count 1 only. 
Complete 120 Hours of Community Service. 
Complete 8 Hours of Driver's Education. 
Complete Cognitive Thinking Program. 
Mental Assessment  and Comply with  any recommended treatment or counseling determined  by the agent..
Obtain Full Time employment or Obtain GED/HSED.
No Driving without a Valid Driver's License. 
Appellate Rights given
Character letter from Quintara Allen, filed.
Character Letter from Felicia Collins, filed.
Sentencing Memorandum, filed.
Character letter from Randy Collins Sr., filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, filed.

Defendant Randy Marill Collins in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Randy Marill Collins in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for jury trial.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, 4, AND 5:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Court vacated jury trial set for today.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Received and filed:  Original Transcript of Proceedings commencing 3/16/2022  (14 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.
/filed.
/filed

Defendant in custody, not produced.  Case remains calendared for plea hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 9:00 am., Branch 40.  If case is not resolved with Judge Shelton, Branch 40, case to return to Judge Paul Van Grunsven, Branch 9 (Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse); final pretrial then to be scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 9:30 am, and jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 9:00 am; deadline to turnover crime lab reports by October 31, 2022 and to file plea forms by November 16, 2022.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Randy Marill Collins not in court, in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court converted jury trial date into plea hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Randy Marill Collins not in court, in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial and scheduling conference. Defense informs the court of defendant's other felony case before Branch 40, 2020CF4639. Court authorizes global resolution of both cases before Branch 40. Court set filing deadlines with the parties. Defense has until July 11th, 2022 to submit any change of plea paperwork. State has until June 17th, 2022 for the State to file any discovery materials except for crime lab reports to defense. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randy Marill Collins in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Randy Marill Collins in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Parties to exchange discovery by 4/11/22. Any motions are to be filed by 5/2/22. Defense counsel to file any plea forms by 5/9/22.  Case is adjourned to Br. 17.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Randy Marill Collins in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen; both appear by video.  Defendant Randy Marill Collins in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 20CF4639. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Lucena-Martinez. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Randy Marill Collins in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Randy Marill Collins in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Randy Marill Collins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
